comment.author: 51039755@N05
comment._content: IWM Q 11145 Taken on 10th August 1918 during King George V visit to Sautrecourt, France. The link above takes you to the Museums Website where the image can be zoomed. On the zoomed image the Crew Number on the male tank is visible, it appears to be "B9" The nose of a third tank is also visible behind the male tank. 9360, OIC 2Lt Lockwood was Hit and burnt out on 2 Sep 1918 whilst in action with 14th tank battalion. The photo was taken during the same visit as: www.flickr.com/photos/nlscotland/4687984633/in/set-721576... Source sites.google.com/site/landships/home/lists/mk-v-tanks/925...
